item.title: Report E-2023070041
item.description:
Report E-2023070041

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-22T00:38:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-29
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LDA experienced a UN3266 Triple-D Universal Coil Cleaner release from a box containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 2' x 2' area of the trailer floor due to improper loading. The damaged pail and impacted cardboard and debris were neutralized with sodium bicarb and containerized into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023070022
item.description:
Report E-2023070022

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-22T00:38:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-30
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Allied International Emergency was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 10ft- by-10ft area of the terminal floor and estimated that twenty (20) gallons of material was released due to forklift damaging eighteen (18) 1-gallon plastic jugs. Allied International Emergency personnel separated the non-damaged plastic jugs and placed them on the side to be shipped onto the consignee. Allied International Emergency personnel neutralized the impacted area and deployed granular absorbents to collect the released material. Allied International Emergency personnel gathered all spent material and debris placed into three (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The impacted pallet was cut-up and placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The empty plastic jugs were placed into an additional 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023061597
item.description:
Report X-2023061597

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-22T00:38:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-21
  • City: AUSTIN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found by PM QA at end of their shift. Hazmat was not declared and was wet at bottom. No markings or labels on package. Was only identified as a Hazmat when QA looked up product for damage report. Left isolated from others until full investigation on what to do next. DescribePack: 1 bottle ruptured inside and cracked; cause from extreme heat and poor packaging of reusing old box. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Package was isolated from VSA and the belt.

item.title: Report E-2023060800
item.description:
Report E-2023060800

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-22T00:38:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-01
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LHO experienced a UN3082 CRODATERIC CAS 50-LQ-(MH) release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 50-gallons of product released to a 6' x 6' area of the dock floor and a 20' x 24' area of the concrete lot below. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The material was transferred into a new tote. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into (3) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was removed from site pending disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023060750
item.description:
Report E-2023060750

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-18T15:09:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-28
  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LSX experienced a UN2876 Resorcinol release from a 165-pound fiber drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-cup of product released to a 1' x 1' area of the tailer floor due to a forklift puncture. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. The released product was collected with absorbents and containerized into a 5-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023060677
item.description:
Report E-2023060677

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-18T15:09:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-07
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 7, 2023, at 1653 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Laredo, Texas regarding the release of approximately 8 ounces of Araldite GY 507 (Environmentally hazardous substances, liquid, n.o.s., UN3082, 9, II) from (1) 55-gal metal drum. The release was reported due to a loose bung and was contained to the top of the metal drum. Contractors tightened the loose bung and wiped down the top of the drum, and forwarded the product on to the consignee. No waste was generated from this event.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: BOX LEFT OUTSIDE OF HWPA. DescribePack: BOX WET AND TORN ON OPPOSITE SIDES. INSIDE, 2 PF THE 4 BOTTLES LEAKING. ONE BOTTLE HAD A GROSSLY MISALLIGNED CAP AND BROKEN SEAL. THE OTHER BOTTLE'S SEAL HAD A SMALL HOLE AND SLIGHTLY MISALLIGNED CAP. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: THE CAPS WERE SCREWED ON PROPERLY AND THE BOTTLES AND BOX WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found in a plastic bag in a carrying tote in the QA damage area and moved to Hazmat processing area for inspection. DescribePack: Upon inspection, cap on plastic container could be tightened with a small twist. Container was still mostly full. Box was wet near top side of container. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Leakage was not spreading. Package was placed in a salvage drum during inspection.

item.title: Report X-2023061124
item.description:
Report X-2023061124

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-17T15:10:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-13
  • City: EDINBURG
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: At approximately 7:40 am QA was called to belt 4 by management. A HazMat had been sent up the IC belt and onto belt 4. The manager saw that the plastic bucket appeared to have a leak. When QA arrived and inspected the item a slow leak was found to be coming from the lid. Item was secured and isolated them place by in a salvage drum and taken to the QA cage for safe keeping until it could be process post sort. DescribePack: The plastic bucket was found to have a slow leak emanating from its lids' gaskets/seal. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA quickly responded when notified about the possible damage. The item was isolated and secured for safe keeping in a yellow salvage drum away from other packages and any persons.

DescribePack: Upon inspection, no loose caps or active leakage were found. One plastic bottle was slightly less full than the other. Both had dry stains on them. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Leakage was not spreading. Package was contained in a tote when found.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the large battery (un2794) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 3 gallons of acid. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.
